AGENT_DEFAULT.title: Unable to reach the cPGuard agent running on your server
AGENT_DEFAULT.message: Check if our IPs are whitelisted on the server

A-C6.title: Server not reachable
A-C6.message: We cannot reach your server. Check your server is online and reachable from our IPs

A-C28.title: Connection timed out
A-C28.message: Cannot reach the agent service running on your server. Check if our IPs are whitelisted on the server

faq.title: Timeout Error - A-C28
faq.desc-1: The App Portal services must be able to communicate to the agent service, which is running on port 9098 on the servers. Since this is a custom port, we do not open it but we recommend opening the App Portal IPs on your server.
faq.desc-2: During cPGuard installation, we whitelist necessary IPs in CSF which is the recommended firewall along with cPGuard.
faq.desc-3: If you have a custom firewall on your server or in front of your server, you must whitelist the following IPs listed.

A-C7-1.title: Agent not reachable
A-C7-1.message: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent on port 9098: Connection refused
A-C7-1.message-ip: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent({{server_ip}}) on port {{port}}: Connection refused

faq.title: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent on port 9098: Connection refused
faq.title-ip: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent ({{server_ip}}) on port {{port}}: Connection refused
faq.desc-1: This issue happens if the agent service is not properly running and not responding to the request from App Portal. The agent service is set up to start automatically if the license is valid…so if the agent is not running most likely it points to a license issue.
faq.desc-2: In such a case, please run the following command and ensure that your license status is good.
faq.desc-3: If there is a license error, please fix it or contact support for any related assistance. If the license is showing as valid, please contact support for further assistance.

A-C7-2.title: Agent not reachable
A-C7-2.message: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent on port 9098: No route to host
A-C7-2.message-ip: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent ({{server_ip}}) on port {{port}}: No route to host

faq.title: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent on port 9098: No route to host
faq.title-ip: Failed to connect to cPGuard agent on port 9098: No route to host
faq.desc-1: This issue happens if the server or network firewall blocks connection from the app portal to the cPGuard agent service. Please make sure that the following IPs can connect to TCP port 9098 on your server.
faq.desc-2: Please note that you need to add the above whitelist in your server firewall and network firewall if applicable ( it is common for cloud servers like AWS, Azure, DigitalOcean, Vultr, Hetzner, etc ).
faq.desc-3: Please contact support if you need further assistance.

A-502.title: Agent not reachable
A-502.message: cPGuard agent service on your server is not running or is unreachable.

A-500.title: Invalid response from Agent
A-500.message: Unexpected response/error received from agent service on the server. Please try again later.

A-503.title: Invalid response from Agent
A-503.message: Unexpected response/error received from agent service on the server. Please try again later.

A-504.title: Request is taking too long
A-504.message: Timeout reached before completing the request on your server. Try again with a smaller data set or check server load

A-401.title: Unauthorized API call
A-401.message: Agent is not online. Please try again later.

A-403.title: Invalid credentials
A-403.message: Data couldn't be fetched from your server due to an API authentication error

A-400.title: Error in request
A-400.message: Unexpected error/response recived from agent service running on the server. Please try again later.

A-417.title: Error in request
A-417.message: Unexpected error/response recived from agent service running on the server. Please try again later.

A-license-abuse.title: License abuse detected

instructions.setp-1-info-1: You can obtain a new license key by
instructions.setp-1-info-3: if you havent already done it
instructions.setp-2-info-1: Check you registered email for instructions to install cPGuard on your server
instructions.setp-2-info-2: You can also find detailed instructions on how to install cPGuard at our
instructions.setp-3-info-1: After installing your license key your server will be automatically bound with the cloud. You can refresh your server list to see if the new server is listed.
instructions.setp-3-info-2: If your server is not listed please try the following troubleshooting steps

setp-3-info-3.li-1: Check and confirm if all IPs of our cloud (listed here) are whitelisted on your server
setp-3-info-3.li-2: Our agent uses port 9098 by default. Ensure the port is not used by other services
setp-3-info-3.li-3: Try restarting our agent service by running /opt/cpguard/restart.sh as root

server-details.attacks-blocked-desc: There is a {{value}}% decrease in comparison with previous month

scan-btn.full-scan-desc: Start a full scan on all accounts

invalid.title: Default Hostname Is Not a Valid Domain
invalid.message: The server’s default hostname is not a valid domain. A valid domain is required for certain control panel features to function correctly

error.title: Domain DNS Not Pointed to Server
error.message: The default domain is not pointing to this server’s IP address. DNS must be configured properly for full functionality of the control panel

ssl.title: Failed to Obtain SSL Certificate
ssl.message: Automatic SSL setup failed for the default domain. This may limit access to some control panel features. Please ensure the domain is valid, publicly accessible, and correctly pointed to this server.

csf-config.title: CSF Configuration
csf-config.sub-title: Highly recommended configurations that can improve security of your server

lf-alerts.title: LF ALERTS
lf-alerts.desc: These options will help to alert you or run action when certain actions happen on the server.
lf-alerts.alert-desc: Alert on detection of spamming scripts
lf-alerts.lf-script-action-desc: Enable cPGuard script to check report and suspend email account  when LF_SCRIPT_ALERT event is triggered
lf-alerts.lf-ssh-email-alert-desc: Send an email alert if anyone logs in successfully using SSH
lf-alerts.lf-cpanel-alert-users-desc: List of accounts to send alerts for; use all for ALL users
lf-alerts.lf-cpanel-alert-desc: Send an email alert if anyone accesses WHM/cPanel via an account listed in LF_CPANEL_ALERT_USERS.

local-host-relay.title: Relay Tracking
local-host-relay.localhost-relay-desc: Relay Tracking. This allows you to track email that is relayed through the server. There are also options to send alerts and block external IP addresses if the number of emails relayed per hour exceeds configured limits.
local-host-relay.rt-localhost-relay-alert-desc: Enable alert for emails sent via a local IP addresses
local-host-relay.RT_RELAY_ALERT-desc: This option triggers for external email
local-host-relay.RT_AUTHRELAY_ALERT-desc: This option triggers for email authenticated by SMTP AUTH
local-host-relay.RT_ACTION-warn: Enabling this will overwrite your existing custom configuration
local-host-relay.RT_POPRELAY_ALERT-desc: This option triggers for email authenticated by POP before SMTP

synflood.title: SYNFLOOD Configuration
synflood.synflood-desc: Enable SYN Flood Protection. This option configures iptables to offer some protection from tcp SYN packet DOS attempts. You should set the RATE so that false-positives are kept to a minimum otherwise visitors may see connection issues (check /var/log/messages for *SYNFLOOD Blocked*).

allow-deny.title: ALLOW/DENY COUNTRY
allow-deny.desc: Country Code to CIDR allow/deny. In the following two options you can allow or deny whole country CIDR ranges. The CIDR blocks are generated from the MaxMind GeoLite2 Country database at: https://dev.MaxMind.com/geoip/geoip2/geolite2/ This feature relies entirely on that service being available

disabled.title: CSF not Running
disabled.desc: CSF Firewall is not running on the server. Please install/enable it to use this feature
disabled.standalone: CSF is not compatible on this control panel

LF_EMAIL_ALERT.title: Login Failure Blocking and Alerts
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.desc: These options are application specific and trigger is the number of failures against that application that will trigger LFD to block the IP address
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.LF_EMAIL_ALERT: Send an email alert if an IP address is blocked by one of the LF threshold triggers
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.LF_SSHD: Enable login failure detection of sshd connections ( 0 is disabled )
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.LF_FTPD: Enable login failure detection of ftp connections ( 0 is disabled )
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.LF_SMTPAUTH: Enable login failure detection of SMTP AUTH connections ( 0 is disabled )
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.LF_EXIMSYNTAX: Enable syntax failure detection of Exim connections ( 0 is disabled )
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.LF_POP3D: Enable login failure detection of pop3 connections ( 0 is disabled )
LF_EMAIL_ALERT.LF_IMAPD: Enable login failure detection of imap connections ( 0 is disabled )

network-port.title: IPv4 Port Settings
network-port.desc: TCP and UDP ports allowed for incoming connections

allow-ip.title: Allow IP Address
allow-ip.desc: Whitelist IP and add to the allow file (csf.allow)

block-ip.title: Block IP Address
block-ip.desc: Blacklist IP and add to the deny file (csf.deny)

ignore-ip.title: Ignore IP Address
ignore-ip.desc: Let lfd ignore the IP and add to the ignore file (csf.ignore)

unblock-ip.title: Unblock IP Address
unblock-ip.desc: Remove IP address from the firewall (temp and perm blocks)

check-ip.title: Check IP Address
check-ip.desc: Check your IP address status in the firewall

quick-actions.allowed: Cannot deny {{ip}}. IP is in csf.allow
quick-actions.ignored: Cannot deny {{ip}}. IP is in csf.ignore
quick-actions.not-installed: Action failed. Looks like CSF is not installed or running
quick-actions.failed: Action failed. Check if CSF is setup properly and running on the server
quick-actions.invalid: {{ip}} address is not a valid IP/CIDR
quick-actions.unblock-not-found: {{ip}} is not in any block list

scanner-tiles.full-scan-desc: Start a full scan on all accounts
scanner-tiles.hint-no-scan: No scan has been performed yet
scanner-tiles.path-scan-desc: Absolute path of the directory you wish to scan

dialog.title: Confirm ?
dialog.desc: Are you sure you want to stop this scan.

modal-data.warn-cms: This {{cms}} installation appears to be broken. To be safe, try to fix it or remove if unwanted.

report.false: Something went wrong please try again later

waf_configurations.title: WAF Configurations
waf_configurations.waf_server_desc: The server in which ModSecurity is installed and WAF rules should be loaded. You need ModSecurity version 2.9.4 or higher to enable cPGuard WAF on your server.
waf_configurations.waf_server_conf_desc: The file into which we can include cPGuard WAF ModSecurity configuration/rules. If file exists new lines will be appended else a file will be created at the location
waf_configurations.waf_server_restart_cmd_desc: Command to restart server and apply new configuration. Please make sure to provide full path to executables
waf_configurations.waf_server_error_log_desc: The file to which the WAF server logs errors. If left empty, cPGuard will automatically try known locations.
waf_configurations.waf_audit_log_desc: The file into which we can include cPGuard WAF ModSecurity configuration/rules. ModSecurity Audit log file/directory in which news logs are being written. If left empty, cPGuard will automatically try known locations.

sec-tools.ipdb-dos-switch-desc: Protect against Denial of Service (DoS) attacks.

sec-tools.whitelisted-ips-desc: Choose IPs that should be always allowed by the bruteforce engine and IPDB Firewall
sec-tools.whitelisted-domains-desc: Choose domains that should always be allowed by the captcha and bruteforce rules

add-setting.proactive-process-monitor-info: Periodically scan and kill suspected processes running under users

backup.title: Website Backup
backup.backup-type-desc: Choose how your data is saved. Each type balances speed, storage, and completeness differently.
backup.backup-type-compressed-desc: Save all of your information, use less disk space, but take more time to create a backup.
backup.backup-type-uncompressed-desc: Save all of your information, use more disk space, but take less time to complete a backup.
backup.backup-type-incremental-desc: Save only the changes made since the last backup, using less disk space and time.
backup.disk-space-desc: Ensure you have enough disk space for the backup. If not, the backup will fail.
backup.schedule-and-retention-desc: Set how often backups are created and how long they are kept.
backup.daily-backup-desc: Create a backup every day at the specified time.
backup.weekly-backup-desc: Create a backup every week on the specified day and time.
backup.monthly-backup-desc: Create a backup every month on the specified day and time.
backup.daily-retention-desc: Enter the number of daily backups that you wish to keep before deleting older ones.
backup.weekly-retention-desc: Enter the number of weekly backups that you wish to keep before deleting older ones.
backup.monthly-retention-desc: Enter the number of monthly backups that you wish to keep before deleting older ones.
backup.warning: You must select at least one backup timing setting.
backup.backup-directory-desc: Choose where your backups will be stored. Ensure the directory has enough space.
backup.exclude-websites-desc: Select websites that you do not want to include in the backup.

cron.title: Cron Jobs
cron.desc: Cron jobs allow you to automate certain commands or scripts on your site. You can set a command or script to run at a specific time every day, week, etc. For example, you could set a cron job to delete temporary files every week to free up disk space.
cron.warning: Warning: You need to have a good knowledge of Linux commands before you can use cron jobs effectively. Check your script with your hosting administrator before adding a cron job.
cron.simple-desc: Selecting Common Settings will prefill the following fields or else the fields can be updated individually

delete.title: Delete Cron job
delete.desc: Are you sure you want to delete this cron job?

email.desc: Send an email with the output every time the cron job runs.
email.desc-2: You can have cron send an email every time it runs a command which output. If you do not want an email to be sent for an individual cron job, you can redirect the command's output to /dev/null. For example:<span class='cp-red ms-2'>mycommand >/dev/null 2>&1

nginx.title: Nginx Settings
nginx.static_files_desc: File extensions to serve directly by NGINX without passing to backend. Use | to separate types, e.g. jpg|png|css|js.
nginx.expires_desc: Define how long browsers should cache static files served by NGINX. Helps improve load times and reduce server load.
nginx.additional_headers_desc: Custom HTTP headers to add in all NGINX responses. Useful for security, caching, or custom behavior.
nginx.cors_domains_desc: List of domains allowed to make cross-origin requests. Controls the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header in NGINX responses.
nginx.custom_config_desc: Enter additional directives for Nginx configuration.
nginx.save_error: Failed to save Nginx settings. Please try again.
nginx.invalid_header_key: Invalid header name. Must be a valid HTTP header format (e.g., Cache-Control, X-Frame-Options).
nginx.index_files_error: Invalid format — use space-separated filenames, e.g. index.html default.html.
nginx.use_only_alnum_pipe_example: Use only alphanumeric, underscore, period, or hyphen characters separated by | (e.g. jpg|png|css|js).
nginx.use_only_alnum_pipe: Use only alphanumeric, underscore, period, or hyphen characters separated by |.
nginx.invalid_domains_example: Invalid domains — provide valid space-separated URLs, e.g. https://example.com https://example2.com.
nginx.static_expiry_numeric: Static expiry must be a numeric value.
nginx.confirm_switch_custom: Are you sure you want to switch to Custom?
nginx.confirm_switch_default: Are you sure you want to switch to Default?
nginx.confirm_unsaved_switch_default: Are you sure you want to discard unsaved changes and switch to Default?
nginx.confirm_unsaved_switch_custom: Are you sure you want to discard unsaved changes and switch to Custom?

php.title: PHP Settings
php.php_engine_desc: Change the PHP version your website is running. We recommend using the latest PHP version for the best performance.
php.restart_php_desc: This will restart the PHP container, reload the php.ini and the redis.conf for this site and its add-on domains.
php.error-updating-php: An error occurred while updating PHP settings
php.directive-exist: This directive already exists, Use the edit option
php.directive-unsupported: This directive cannot be customised here. Please change it in the option provided above
php.error-removing-config: An error occurred while removing the config
php.error-saving-config: An error occurred while saving the config
php.error-adding-config: An error occurred while adding the config
php.select-supported-php-version: Please select a supported PHP version

php_ini_block.title: PHP INI basic settings
php_ini_block.memory_limit_desc: The maximum amount of memory in bytes a script is allowed to allocate.
php_ini_block.max_execution_time_desc: The maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to run before it is terminated.
php_ini_block.max_input_time_desc: The maximum time in seconds a script is allowed to parse input data.
php_ini_block.post_max_size_desc: The maximum size in bytes of data that can be posted with the POST method. Typically, should be larger than upload_max_filesize and smaller than memory_limit.
php_ini_block.upload_max_filesize_desc: The maximum size in bytes of an uploaded file.
php_ini_block.display_errors_desc: Determines whether errors should be displayed as a part of the output.
php_ini_block.log_errors_desc: Enable the logging of PHP errors.

php_general.title: More PHP Settings
php_general.include_path_desc: The list of directories where scripts look for files (similar to system's PATH variable). To separate directories, use a colon (:) on Linux and a semicolon (;) on Windows.
php_general.session_save_path_desc: The directory to store PHP session files.
php_general.mail_force_extra_parameters_desc: Allows you to pass additional parameters to the mail() function. This is useful for setting headers or other options.
php_general.open_basedir_desc: Files in the specified directories can be accessed by PHP scripts. To separate directories, use a colon (:) on Linux and a semicolon (;) on Windows.
php_general.allow_url_fopen_desc: Allows PHP file functions to retrieve data from remote locations over FTP or HTTP.
php_general.short_open_tag_desc: Allows the short form (<? ?>) of the PHP's open tag.
php_general.opcache_enable_desc: Enables the opcode cache. When disabled, code is not optimised or cached.
php_general.disable_functions_desc: This directive allows you to disable certain functions. It takes on a comma-delimited list of function names.

additional_directives.title: Additional PHP Directives
additional_directives.alert: Only add settings here if you're sure about them or have been instructed to. Incorrect values might cause issues with your site.
additional_directives.php_ini_editor_desc: Use this section to define additional PHP configuration directives that aren’t already listed above. These values will be included in the final php.ini or FPM configuration and allow advanced customization of your PHP environment.

php_fpm_block.title: PHP-FPM Settings
php_fpm_block.pm_desc: Choose how the process manager will control the number of child processes. Possible values: static, ondemand, dynamic. This option is mandatory.
php_fpm_block.pm_max_children_desc: The number of child processes to be created when pm is set to static and the maximum number of child processes to be created when pm is set to dynamic.
php_fpm_block.pm_max_requests_desc: The number of requests each child process should execute before respawning. This can be useful to work around memory leaks in 3rd party libraries. For endless request processing specify '0'. Equivalent to PHP_FCGI_MAX_REQUESTS. Default value: 0.
php_fpm_block.numeric_error: Please enter a valid numeric value.
php_fpm_block.pm_start_servers_desc: The number of child processes created on startup. Used only when pm is set to dynamic. Default Value: (min_spare_servers + max_spare_servers) / 2.
php_fpm_block.pm_min_spare_servers_desc: The desired minimum number of idle server processes. Used only when pm is set to dynamic. Also mandatory in this case.
php_fpm_block.pm_max_spare_servers_desc: The desired maximum number of idle server processes. Used only when pm is set to dynamic. Also mandatory in this case.
